summary: A grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JP Morgan Chase Bank, demanding extensive financial records related to an investigation into violations including sex trafficking and coercion. The subpoena seeks records from account inception to present for specified individuals/organizations, with a return date of September 17, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Date by which JP Morgan Chase Bank is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: Date the grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
JP Morgan Chase Bank N.A., National Subpoena Processing, 7610 West Washington Street, Indianapolis, Indiana 46231-1335
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).

It demands extensive financial records from JP Morgan Chase, including wire transfers, signature cards, safe deposit records, credit card statements, and online banking information, from account inception to present.
The subpoena includes a non-disclosure request, instructing JP Morgan Chase not to inform any third party about the subpoena due to the ongoing nature of the investigation.
The requested records pertain to specific individuals and/or organizations, though their names are not listed in the provided text (likely in a separate rider or attachment).
